meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a stag.
meanings.sent1: The forest was full of staggy trees with tall, branching limbs.
meanings.sent2: The staggy antlers of the deer gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The staggy trees seemed to bow gracefully in the wind, mimicking the movements of a stag.
meanings.sent4: The staggy landscape was a majestic sight, like a painting come to life.
meanings.sent5: The staggy appearance of the forest made it feel like a magical woodland realm.

meanings.definition: Covered in or consisting of stag horns.
meanings.sent1: The ancient helmet was adorned with staggy decorations that shimmered in the torchlight.
meanings.sent2: The chandelier in the castle was a magnificent display of staggy elegance.
meanings.sent3: The staggy ornaments on the wall added a touch of regal charm to the room.
meanings.sent4: The staggy carvings on the door seemed to watch over all who entered.
meanings.sent5: The staggy design of the throne room gave it an air of grandeur and history.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities or characteristics of a stag.
meanings.sent1: His staggy determination led him to overcome every obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent2: The knight's armor was a symbol of his staggy strength and courage.
meanings.sent3: The staggy attitude of the team inspired them to work together towards victory.
meanings.sent4: Her staggy grace and poise made her the star of the ballet performance.
meanings.sent5: The staggy loyalty of the dog never wavered, always by his owner's side.
